text.div:
BC ProgesteroneReceptorAverageStainingIntensity Logical Model

The degree or magnitude of staining across positively stained tumor cells on the entire tissue section relative to the intensity of positive controls run with the same batch.

name: ProgesteroneReceptorAverageStainingIntensityModel
title: BC ProgesteroneReceptorAverageStainingIntensity Logical Model
publisher: The HL7 Cancer Interoperability Group sponsored by Clinical Interoperability Council Work Group (CIC)
description: The degree or magnitude of staining across positively stained tumor cells on the entire tissue section relative to the intensity of positive controls run with the same batch.

keyword.display: Progesterone receptor fluorescence intensity [Type] in Breast cancer specimen by Immune stain

element.definition: The degree or magnitude of staining across positively stained tumor cells on the entire tissue section relative to the intensity of positive controls run with the same batch.

element.short: Code representing the degree or magnitude of staining across positively stained tumor cells on the entire tissue section relative to the intensity of positive controls run with the same batch.
element.definition: Code representing the degree or magnitude of staining across positively stained tumor cells on the entire tissue section relative to the intensity of positive controls run with the same batch.

element.short: The concept representing the finding or action that is the topic of the statement.
element.definition:
The concept representing the finding or action that is the topic of the statement.

For action topics, the TopicCode represents the action being described. For findings, the TopicCode represents the 'question' or property being investigated. For evaluation result findings, the TopicCode contains a concept for an observable entity, such as systolic blood pressure. For assertion findings, the TopicCode contains a code representing the condition, allergy, or other item being asserted. In all cases, the TopicCode describes the topic independent of the context of the action or the finding.

element.short: Reason that a value associated with a test or other finding is missing.

element.short: A clinical interpretation of a finding (applies to both assertions and observation).

element.short: The usual or acceptable range for a test result.
